title: Parameter Message
description: The schema for the Parameter Metadata Language from Section 5 of E1.37-5. This schema is subject to change.

get_request_subdevice_range.$comment: 'subdevices' already contains a title and description.

set_request_subdevice_range.$comment: 'subdevices' already contains a title and description.

bit.title: Bit
bit.description: Describes the meaning of one bit in a bit field.

reserved.title: Reserved
reserved.description: Indicates that this bit is unused or reserved.

reservedValue.title: Reserved value
reservedValue.description: The assumed value when the bit is marked as reserved.

bitFieldType.title: Bit field type
bitFieldType.description: A bit field, a collection of 'bit' items. The "size" field is used to specify the number of bits in this bit field, a multiple of 8. It is an error if the size is less than the number of defined bits. Bits that are not specified are assumed to be reserved, with a value equal to the "valueForUnspecified" value.

size.title: Size
size.description: The size, in multiples-of-8 bits, of this bit field. It is an error if the size is less than the number of defined bits.

valueForUnspecified.title: Value for unspecified
valueForUnspecified.description: The default value to use for any unspecified bits.

booleanType.title: Boolean type
booleanType.description: A Boolean value. This corresponds to the DS_BOOLEAN type in "Table A-15: Data Type Defines" of the RDM E1.20 specification, a 1-byte zero-or-one value.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: A list of labels that name special values.

bytesType.title: Bytes type
bytesType.description: A list of bytes. The minimum and maximum length properties are not required, but it is a good idea to specify their values for unknown bytes types.

format.title: Interpretation format
format.description: This field describes how to interpret the value. It can be one of the bytes types defined in "Table A-15: Data Type Defines" of the RDM E1.20 specification (or other add-on specifications), or it can be something manufacturer-specific. Be aware, however, that anything not defined here may not be understood by a controller or UI. The known bytes types include: ipv4 (4 bytes), ipv6 (16 bytes), mac-address (6 bytes), uid (6 bytes), and uuid (16 bytes).

minLength.title: Minimum length
minLength.description: The minimum bytes length. Care must be taken to make sure this doesn't contradict any "maxLength" value. It is an error if there is a contradiction.

maxLength.title: Maximum length
maxLength.description: The maximum bytes length. Care must be taken to make sure this doesn't contradict any "minLength" value. It is an error if there is a contradiction.

command.$comment: The title is specific to where this used, and so no title is defined here.
command.description: The contents of an RDM command: 1. a collection of 'field' items, each a simple or compound type, 2. a single 'field' item, or 3. a duplicate command.

oneOf.title: List of fields
oneOf.description: The command consists of one or more fields.

oneOf.title: Single field
oneOf.description: The command consists of a single field.

oneOf.title: Command duplicate
oneOf.description: Indicates that a command is a duplicate of one of the other commands. Using this feature can potentially save space.

commonPropertiesForNamed.$comment: Defines a set of properties common to everything having a name.

name.title: Name
name.description: The object name. If this is not intended for UI display, then a displayable name can be added with "displayName".

displayName.title: Display name
displayName.description: An optional name for UI display.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Contains any notes about this object.

resources.title: List of resources
resources.description: Informative URLs pointing to a specification or more information for this field type.

compoundType.title: Compound type
compoundType.description: Defines a compound type, a type used to combine other types. This is useful for including in lists.

subtypes.title: Subtypes
subtypes.description: A list of types composing this compound type.

integerType.title: Integer type
integerType.description: A signed or unsigned integer, can have an optional prefix, unit, and range.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: A list of labels that name special values.

restrictToLabeled.title: Restrict to labeled
restrictToLabeled.description: Whether to restrict the allowed values to those that have labels. This is useful to not have to additionally specify a set of ranges. If this is set to "true" then "ranges" should not be specified.

ranges.title: Ranges
ranges.description: A list of possible ranges for the value. The complete range is the union of all the ranges. This should not be specified if "restrictToLabeled" is set to 'true'.

units.title: Units
units.description: The units type, defined in Table A-13 of E1.20.

prefixPower.title: Prefix power
prefixPower.description: The power of 10 to be used as the prefix for the value. For example, -2 is used to represent 10^(-2) or the prefix centi-.

prefixBase.title: Prefix base
prefixBase.description: The base of the prefix. For example, to express "kilo", specify prefixPower=3 and prefixBase=10, and to express "kibi", specify prefixPower=10 and prefixBase=2 or prefixPower=1 and prefixBase=1024.

labeledBoolean.title: Labeled Boolean
labeledBoolean.description: Associates a name to a Boolean value.

labeledInteger.title: Labeled integer
labeledInteger.description: Associates a name to an integer value.

listType.title: List type
listType.description: A list of objects all having the same type.
listType.$comment: The names "minItems" and "maxItems" were chosen because those match the validation keywords for arrays in the JSON schema spec.

itemType.title: Item type
itemType.description: The type of each item in the list.

oneOfTypes.$comment: One of any of the types. This provides a single location to keep the list.

pdEnvelopeType.title: PD envelope type
pdEnvelopeType.description: Contains a length/data pair for one Parameter Data item, where the length is an unsigned 8-bit value and the data has 'length' bytes. This exists to provide a schema definition for the 'envelope' of a PDL/PD pair.

length.title: Data length
length.description: The data length can be optionally specified.

range.title: Range
range.description: Defines an inclusive range of numbers. If one of the bounds is undefined then it is assumed to be the bound appropriate for the type.

refType.title: Reference type
refType.description: Specifies a reference to another value, a URI whose fragment part, if present, is a JSON pointer. See RFCs 3986 (URI Syntax) and 6901 (JSON Pointer).

$ref.title: Reference
$ref.description: Points to a resource, a URI.

stringType.title: String type
stringType.description: A UTF-8-encoded string having a possibly bounded size. Implementations may need to use either a NUL terminator or another "length" field for multi-field messages where a string is followed by another field, so that its boundary can be determined.

format.title: Interpretation format
format.description: This field describes how to interpret the string value. It can be one of the string types defined in "Table A-15: Data Type Defines" of the RDM E1.20 specification (or other add-on specifications), one of the defined formats from the JSON Schema Validation specification (https://json-schema.org/draft/2019-09/json-schema-validation.html#rfc.section.7.3), or it can be something manufacturer-specific. Be aware, however, that anything not defined here may not be understood by a controller or UI. The known string types from E1.20 (and add-ons) include: hostname (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1123#section-2.1, https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5891#section-4.4), json (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7159), string, and url (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986, https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1738).

pattern.title: Pattern
pattern.description: An ECMA-262 regular expression (https://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-262.htm) that can be used to validate the contents of this field. They're helpful for assisting a controller or UI do message validation. It's not necessary to provide a pattern for known "format" types. Note that care must be taken to make sure that patterns don't contradict any "minLength" and "maxLength" values. It is an error if there is a contradiction. As well, if there are maximum or minimum sizes, it is suggested that an instance makes use of the "minLength" and "maxLength" sizes in order to support those UIs that don't support regexes.

minLength.title: Minimum length
minLength.description: The minimum string length, in characters. Care must be taken to make sure this doesn't contradict any "pattern" or "maxLength" values. It is an error if there is a contradiction. If there are maximum or minimum sizes, it is suggested that an instance makes use of the "minLength" and "maxLength" sizes in order to support those UIs that don't support regexes.

maxLength.title: Maximum length
maxLength.description: The maximum string length, in characters. Care must be taken to make sure this doesn't contradict any "pattern" or "minLength" values. It is an error if there is a contradiction. If there are maximum or minimum sizes, it is suggested that an instance makes use of the "minLength" and "maxLength" sizes in order to support those UIs that don't support regexes.

maxBytes.title: Maximum length in bytes
maxBytes.description: In the case that the number of characters in the string is different from the number of bytes after UTF-8 encoding, we may need to specify a maximum encoded length.

restrictToASCII.title: Restrict to ASCII
restrictToASCII.description: Indicates whether the string contents should be restricted to US-ASCII.

subdevices.title: Sub-devices
subdevices.description: Acceptable values for the subdevice in a GET or SET command. An empty list means allow nothing.
